results.title: The Kid
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Christina Steinberg, Hunt Lowry, Junction Entertainment and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Bruce Willis plays Russ Duritz, an emotionally detached image consultant who is a winner in business, but a loser in all other areas of his life, especially in regards to his interpersonal skills. Upon meeting Rusty (a ten year old version of himself) Russ starts to reshape himself into a more humane being, partly by revisiting, understanding, and even altering, his past. Cast also includes Spencer Breslin, Emily Mortimer, Lily Tomlin, Chi McBride, Jean Smart.

results.title: The Karate kid. Part 2
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen and Jerry Weintraub
results.brief_description: Karate kid, Daniel travels to Japan with his teacher, Miyagi, to visit Miyagi’s dying father. It’s a troubled trip for Daniel and his teacher as Miyagi returns to face his sworn enemy. Daniel becomes involved in the hate-ridden vendetta and whereas before he fought in a contest where a trophy was at stake, Daniel now plays a game that’s a fight to the death.

results.title: The Jungle Book
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.credit_line:
Disney Studio Artist

Story Sketch

Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.material_description: Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.brief_description: Another animated classic from the Disney studios. Mowgli, the man-cub raised by wolves, must leave the jungle to take his place in the man-village. The journey is a dangerous one as Shere-Khan, the mighty tiger has sworn to kill the man-cub. Mowgli, accompanied by his loyal friends, Bagheera the panther, and Baloo, the irresponsible bear, meet an array of friends who help Mowgli escape Shere-Khan. A delightful score and voices by stars such as Phil Harris, George Sanders and Sebastion Cabot, make this a “song-filled celebration you’ll never forget.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.description:
When the jungle comes alive with rumours of the man-hating tiger Shere Khan’s return, the wise panther Bagheera knows he’ll have to get the man-cub Mowgli to safety. After being raised by wolves in the Indian jungle, Mowgli is reluctant to leave his home – despite the impending danger. Under the guidance of Bagheera and the laid-back bear Baloo, Mowgli adventures through the jungle to discover friendship, loyalty and his place in the world, while meeting a fabulous cast of friends and foes.

The Jungle Book (1967), Walt Disney Animation Studio’s classic musical adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s beloved book, has been an animated favourite for over 50 years and features the voice talents of some of the biggest stars of the day, as well as gorgeous animation, classic characters and iconic music and songs from the Sherman Brothers and Terry Gilkyson.

Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston supervised the animation for Mowgli and Baloo, who feature in the above sketch. The contrasting size and movements of the young boy and easy-going bear balance one another throughout the film. In the lively musical sequence the “Bare Necessities”, Mowgli appears clumsy and a little unsure while the wise Baloo dances gracefully to the rhythm of the accompanying jazz music, all the while showing Mowgli the ways of the jungle.
description_for_label:

results.title: The Journalist
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Pom Oliver and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Follow the turbulent fortunes of Simon Morris, a top reporter and feature writer for a major daily newspaper. The newspaper is just a background to Simon’s lifestyle, particularly his relationship with women. Stars Jack Thompson, Elizabeth Alexander and Sam Neill.

results.title: The Journey
results.creator_credit: Christopher Tuckfield, Patricia L'Huede, Aeriel and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the moving portrayal of the extraordinary journey to Japan of 74 year-old Billie Sinclair, who is deaf, blind and mute. Billie has been deaf since the age of two and lost his sight at age ten, but despite this he is a dedicated traveller who funds his trips by weaving and selling baskets. The landscape of his travels is one of touch and smell, imagination and even memory, for he can still remember the time before he lost his sight as a child. This remarkable man has survived and thrived. His is not a handicap but a blessing for it has encouraged him to keep searching and learning. In Japan he rides a roller coaster, tries his hand at Judo and visits a deaf and blind acupuncturist. His world is so sensual, one almost envies it. This documentary achieves a miraculous thing; it transports those possessed of all their senses into a world where communication is by touch alone. And even more miraculously, this world does not terrify.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Tuckfield, Patricia L’Huede, Aeriel and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: The Jolifou inn
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canada of a hundred years ago seen through the paintings of Cornelius Krieghoff, celebrated Dutch artist and adventurer. The changing seasons, the untamed beauty of the Quebec countryside and the French settlers among whom he lived were an unending source of inspiration to Krieghoff, whose work is a colourful record of French-Canadian life in the mid-19th century. Photography by Lyle Enright and Douglas Roberts. Edited by Colin Low. Music by Louis Applebaum. (Awards: Yorkton; Bilbao; Toronto; Kootenay)

results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.5. a Nation Born
results.brief_description: India hovers between dream and nightmare. The British have departed India, the nation is gripped by terror and violence. Long repressed by colonial rule, the vicious feud between Muslim and Hindu now erupts into butchery, rioting and murder. Rated: M

results.title: The Jogger
results.creator_credit: Steve Karp, Atlantis Films and Perk Productions
results.brief_description: A middle-aged male jogger runs alone thorugh snow-covered Central Park as “the metaphor” for the break-up of a marriage. A dialogue beginning before the marriage and tracing its dissolution, is heard throughout the run. The man’s adult life is traced by the dialogue and raises many questions for the viewer about life and human relations.

results.title: The Invisible keystone
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
A review of how British constitutional government and British forms of law and order became a valued heritage and a unifying link between members of the Commonwealth. The film moves from one Commonwealth country to another to observe how the democratic formula of government is exercised and kept flexible according to the changing ideas of the time, while the Crown symbolizes a continuity and permanence free of politics. A most significant test of this principle was that of India’s rise to nationhood. Edgar McInnis comments on how institutions inherited from Britain were preserved in the country’s statutes.

results.title: Ten days that shook the Commonwealth
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”
This is the first of a series examining the Commonwealth of Nations to see what it really is - what the bonds are that unite, and the differences that divide, this great family scattered over the face of the Earth. Edgar McInnis, president of the Canadian Institute of International Affairs and narrator of the series, discusses relationships between individual members of the Commonwealth and how these relationships withstood the strains of the Suez crisis in 1956.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
